title: Missing Bookmark Icons
content: Strangely some of the icons for my bookmarks have gone missing. They are all present on each tab but missing on the drop down list. I have tried finding the places.sqlite file in my profiles folder but it doesn't seem to exist. I am running v.84.0.2 (64 bit). Has anyone any idea why the icons are missing from one list and not missing from the tabs, I would have thought they would all be stored in the same place and come from the same 'pool' of data? Attached screenshots of tabs showing the icon and the drop down list with generic wireframe globe icon. Any help would be much appreciated.
creator: njtinker

title: Can't enter NZ phone number to sync
content:
Similar to https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1257374 NZ cell phone numbers have 8 to 10 digits (no country code, first two digits are 02). Firefox only accepts 10 digits for some crazy reason. Such a stupid restriction: Just accept any number, including country code. My number has 9 digits. What do I do now?

The justification "we do it because it was the easiest to implement w/o trying to iterate through the list of countries to find a possible match. It was the easiest path forward to getting the feature shipped." in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1468338 is weak at best.
creator: frachg

title: Wordpress tool menu does not "stick" in Firefox
content:
In Wordpress, the editor tool menu at the top of the screen normally sticks to the top of the page. But in Firefox, it will disappear or scroll up with the rest of the page. This is not supposed to happen and doesn't in any other browser we've tested.

Resizing and refreshing the page may temporarily work, but the problem returns.

title: Private browsing doesn't use dark theme
content:
Bug 513418 suggests that private browsing windows are meant to use a dark theme, like Chrome, but this doesn't appear to be the case. Without this it's hard for me to quickly tell the difference between a normal window and a private window.

Is this an intentional change, or is a bug preventing private windows from using a dark theme?
creator: sersorrel

title: "Unable to connect" message
content: Using current Firefox (84.0.2) on an iMac desk computer. Since Apple put out their recent upgrade to OS Big Sur (2019 ~Nov?), Firefox keeps dropping its internet connection. Works for a session, but when I come back a few hours later I see "Unable to connect..." Restarting always gets it back to start another session. But rebooting several times every day gets old. When Firefox is on the blink, Safari browser works fine, no problem. Connection is there. But my fullest set of bookmarks is in Firefox, so I'd rather use Firefox. Even more strange: Safari and Firefox both continue to work on my wife's desktop same iMac, no problem, just not Firefox on mine. Found help article "Firefox can't load websites but other browsers can" (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/firefox-cant-load-websites-other-browsers-can), went through every step to troubleshoot. No go, still drops. Contacted Apple support and they were flummoxed. Any ideas?
creator: prainbow
